docs.snippet: It is as if the nine solo yachtsmen still competing in the Around Alone race are sailing on broken glass these days. Jolted by the accident that took the boat, and almost the life, of Isabelle Autisser this week, those still competing in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is as if the nine solo yachtsmen still competing in the Around Alone race are sailing on broken glass these days. Jolted by the accident that took the boat, and almost the life, of Isabelle Autisser this week, those still competing in the round-the-world competition are feeling a touch more vulnerable. ''This is an area full of ghosts, and I will be happy to get out of it,'' Jean-Pierre Mouligne, a French sailor said in an interview by E-mail yesterday.
docs.abstract: Other solo yachtsmen in Around Alone race, jolted by accident in which Isabelle Autissier lost her boat, and almost her life, are feeling more vulnerable; are scattered in South Pacific, facing gale (M)

headline.main: Sailors Feeling Vulnerable In Treacherous Waters

docs.snippet: One Actor, Nine Parts      Danny Hoch won an Obie award for his Off Broadway show called ''Some People'' in 1994. Now he has a new one-man tour de force called ''Jails, Hospitals and Hip-Hop,'' scheduled on Tuesday and Wednesday at 8 P.M. at the Yale...
docs.lead_paragraph: One Actor, Nine Parts Danny Hoch won an Obie award for his Off Broadway show called ''Some People'' in 1994. Now he has a new one-man tour de force called ''Jails, Hospitals and Hip-Hop,'' scheduled on Tuesday and Wednesday at 8 P.M. at the Yale Repertory Theater in New Haven.

docs.snippet: Negotiations to forge a global biotechnology safety treaty have hit a stalemate here over sharp disagreements between the United States and most developing countries, raising the prospect that the talks could fail.    The talks, which have been under...
docs.lead_paragraph: Negotiations to forge a global biotechnology safety treaty have hit a stalemate here over sharp disagreements between the United States and most developing countries, raising the prospect that the talks could fail. The talks, which have been under way for more than a week, are to end on Tuesday, and it is not unusual in such negotiations for breakthroughs to occur at the 11th hour.
docs.abstract: Impasse develops in talks in Cartagena, Colombia, on global biotechnology treaty to reduce risks to environment that could result from introduction of genes from different species into plants, animals or microorganisms; biggest split is over whether agricultural commodities should be subject to most important requirement of Biosafety Protocol, that exporter of genetically altered crops receive permission in advance from importing nation; US, Argentina, Australia, Canada, Chile and Uruguay oppose requirement, fearing that billions of dollars in annual farm exports could be blocked; European Union and developing countries support it (M)

headline.main: Biotechnology Treaty Stalls as U.S. and Developing Nations Quarrel

docs.snippet: With recession and the steep fall in the Brazilian currency straining their domestic industries, leaders of Mercosur, the Brazilian-led South American customs union, pledged today to coordinate their countries' economic policies and called upon...
docs.lead_paragraph: With recession and the steep fall in the Brazilian currency straining their domestic industries, leaders of Mercosur, the Brazilian-led South American customs union, pledged today to coordinate their countries' economic policies and called upon Europe and the United States to lower trade barriers to agricultural imports from South America. Opening the first meeting of the Mercosur-European Union Business Forum here on Sunday night, President Fernando Henrique Cardoso of Brazil said that Mercosur would not pull back from its goal of regional integration. As recessions are already under way or threatening in several Mercosur countries, the group seems to be turning its sights to outside markets, becoming more a trading bloc than the customs union it has been until now. In addition to Brazil, Mercosur includes Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, with Chile and Bolivia as associate members -- nations in a region called the Southern Cone.
docs.abstract: Leaders of Mercosur, Brazilian-led South American customs union, pledges to coordinate their countries' economic policies and calls upon Europe and US to lower trade barriers to agricultural imports from South America; Brazil's Pres Fernando Henrique Cardoso, opening first meeting of Mercosur-European Union Business Forum, Rio de Janeiro, says Mercosur will not pull back from its goal of regional integration (M)

headline.main: A Latin Bloc Asks U.S. and Europe to Ease Trade Barriers

docs.snippet: The management committee of Major League Soccer met in Dallas yesterday to decide the fate of Sunil Gulati, the league's deputy commissioner and one of its founders. No announcement was made as of last night, and Gulati did not return phone calls to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The management committee of Major League Soccer met in Dallas yesterday to decide the fate of Sunil Gulati, the league's deputy commissioner and one of its founders. No announcement was made as of last night, and Gulati did not return phone calls to his Manhattan home. Gulati is the man most responsible for the execution of the league's single-entity business plan, and has been in charge of signing all players and allocating them to teams.
docs.abstract: Management committee of Major League Soccer meets to decide fate of Sunil Gulati, league's deputy commissioner and one of its founders (M)

docs.snippet: Attempts to forge the world's first global treaty to regulate trade in genetically modified products failed this morning when the United States and five other big agricultural exporters rejected a proposal that had the support of the rest of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Attempts to forge the world's first global treaty to regulate trade in genetically modified products failed this morning when the United States and five other big agricultural exporters rejected a proposal that had the support of the rest of the roughly 130 nations taking part in the talks. The treaty would have required that exporters of genetically altered plants, seeds or other organisms obtain approval in advance from the importing nation. The talks broke down over the question of whether this requirement would also apply to commodities like wheat and corn.
docs.abstract: United States and five other big agricultural exporters reject proposal to require exporters of genetically altered plants, seeds or other organisms to get advance approval from importing nation; other participants in Cartagena, Colombia, talks on forging first global treaty to regulate trade in genetically modified products score what they perceive as US intransigence; talks are suspended at US urging; Canada, Australia, Chile, Argentina and Uruguay back US stand (M)

headline.main: U.S. Sidetracks Pact to Control Gene Splicing

docs.snippet: Rough weather yesterday took a huge bite out of a potential round-the-world sailing victory for Marc Thiercelin of France. The mast on Thiercelin's 60-foot sailboat, Somewhere, broke in two in 30-knot winds and pounding seas off the southeast coast...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rough weather yesterday took a huge bite out of a potential round-the-world sailing victory for Marc Thiercelin of France. The mast on Thiercelin's 60-foot sailboat, Somewhere, broke in two in 30-knot winds and pounding seas off the southeast coast of Argentina in the Around Alone race. The gale forced the leading skipper in the race to seek shelter and repairs at Port Stanley, a coastal city about 200 miles away in the Falkland Islands.
docs.abstract: Rough weather takes huge bite out of a potential round-the-world sailing victory for Marc Thiercelin of France, when mast on his 60-foot sailboat breaks in two; he is able to fashion a jury-rig for his disabled craft and reports that he can proceed on his own (S)

headline.main: Mast Is Broken On Leader's Boat

docs.snippet: The Italian yachtsman who made a daring high seas rescue of a competitor two weeks ago moved into position to take the lead in the Around Alone regatta yesterday.     Officially, Giovanni Soldini trailed Marc Thiercelin by 18 hours, but the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Italian yachtsman who made a daring high seas rescue of a competitor two weeks ago moved into position to take the lead in the Around Alone regatta yesterday. Officially, Giovanni Soldini trailed Marc Thiercelin by 18 hours, but the Frenchman's boat was in the Falkland Islands for repairs after it lost its mast and could be out 8 to 10 days.
docs.abstract: Giovanni Soldini, Italian yachtsman who made daring high seas rescue of competitor two weeks ago, moves into position to take lead in Around Alone regatta (S)

headline.main: Italian Hero Set To Win Third Leg
headline.kicker: PLUS: YACHT RACING -- AROUND ALONE REGATTA

docs.snippet: Giovanni Soldini sailed into port a hero and a winner yesterday in Punta del Este, Uruguay, after capturing the third leg of the Around Alone regatta with a rescued French competitor aboard.     Soldini, 32, docked his 60-foot boat Fila after a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Giovanni Soldini sailed into port a hero and a winner yesterday in Punta del Este, Uruguay, after capturing the third leg of the Around Alone regatta with a rescued French competitor aboard. Soldini, 32, docked his 60-foot boat Fila after a harrowing crossing from Auckland, New Zealand. Isabelle Autissier, whom he rescued from the southern Pacific Ocean off Antarctica on Feb. 16 after her boat overturned, called Soldini a gentleman of the seas for going into harm's way to save her.
docs.abstract: Giovanni Soldini sails into port as winner of third leg of Around Alone regatta (S)

docs.snippet: Isabelle Autissier, the Frenchwoman who was rescued from her capsized yacht in the southern Pacific Ocean two weeks ago in the Around Alone race, reiterated yesterday that she would not compete in any more solo round-the-world races.     Autissier,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Isabelle Autissier, the Frenchwoman who was rescued from her capsized yacht in the southern Pacific Ocean two weeks ago in the Around Alone race, reiterated yesterday that she would not compete in any more solo round-the-world races. Autissier, the first woman to circumnavigate the globe alone, told The Post and Courier of Charleston, S.C.: ''I think it's time for me to do something else. I had 10 wonderful years, but I think now it's done.''
docs.abstract: Isabelle Autissier, Frenchwoman who was rescued from her capsized yacht in southern Pacific Ocean in Around Alone race, says she will not compete in any more solo round-the-world races (S)

headline.main: Autissier Says She Won't Race Alone
